question: Which nation houses "Manovo-Gounda-Saint Floris National Park"?
explanation: The Central African Republic houses Manovo-Gounda-Saint Floris National Park. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The extinct Western Black Rhinoceros was indigenous and endemic to the Central African Republic. It is home to various species such as black rhinoceros, elephants, cheetahs, leopards and wild dogs, red-fronted gazelles and buffalo.
